Thank God the computer-scientists, physicists, & whoever else with pure 
ingenious ideas/formulas, from mathematicians & theorists/experts/young 
brilliance of freelance were all able to group together and solve this 
critical problem; how to remove *U2*'s musically talented & skilled online 
album, *given to iTunes users for FREE*, & permanently delete a 
musicianship that was offensive in its audacity to have real artists play 
real instruments & attempt to force true music of cohesive conceptual 
undertones, lyrical brilliance & vocal deliveries of majestic sincerity, a 
guitarist in an implementation of playing his instrument like an 
otherworldly language that can be innately understood by atmospheric sounds 
ahead of our time, and a drummer that beat a song into adrenaline-ridden 
submission or carry a ballad with measured 'rappah-tah-taps & crystalline 
cymbal delicacies of finely clattering & shattered glass breaking 
deliverance on the outside of an expensive marble path towards the moonlit 
black-ink oceans of a God of Music's isolated island where only the worthy 
musicians get to enjoy the coveted stay and the rest pushed into the inky 
waves where the Tiger Sharks display a spray of burgundy, deep red like a 
mist sprouting into the bright-white moonlight like a pinkish-reddish 
exclamation mark that states; no, Bieber, no Gomez, no Katy - you were 
unworthy and now you yield your last encore of futile, yet paradoxically 
beautiful veil of your life's essence - red against the moon of white; dead 
and serenity of this world never seemed so right. All along, smoking a bit 
of herb, the bassist went from playing a 'beach surf' ditty to the 
reverberating, deep-distorted theme of *Jaws*... and despite the species 
being off; as these were Tiger Sharks for a taste for untalented musical 
flesh; Katy Perry may have had eyes as *big* as a wide-eyed tiger-kitty; 
but nowhere near the teeth of a Tiger Shark, as her musical ability was 
'shitty*, crudely enough to say - but here on this island of talent, she 
gadgets no right to play...
Any of her songs. ; )
Alas, hurry, hurry, (though I can't say why - as there are thousands of 
websites that will show you how to rid yourself of a record that is divine) 
- but get rid of U2 - you do not need the pretense of attention, that can 
possibly like a band of skillful invention!... Get 'em off so you can, in 
peace, listen to *One Direction*! Muhahahaaha ; )﻿

Want more lyrics meanings? You have got no idea what you are trying to 
delete.....history will absolve these guys......... you wait..you haters 
will seem to history. as gimme generation ignorants. Like Beatle haters 
 just out of touch....with why is real and trust me they are real... .

. Every Breaking Wave.
This song breaks in gently like the sea shore like we all of us….in this 
rock n roll and life journey are all like coming across life events as 
waves it seems or this couple is.like the heart beats of Adam’s bass.., 
fighting again the the inevitability of time and changing storms of life 
and breaking waves…….as if we are somehow fighting against nature 
itself…and pour own energy and choices and desires as The Edge seems to 
make plain with Bono’s words, again there is a synthesised atmospherics 
around the song that sings of hope and something more with hope as does 
Bono’s undulating voice......this relationship, it seems they fear to win 
so they end before they even begin but they can be ready to be swept off 
their feet if they only stopped trying to chase every breaking wave……which 
you can read so much into…. with so many of us being at sea near drowning 
it is no sin as we are in deep..and that the goal is to be safe in deep 
ocean and safe on the shore……….the song says it a choice as hearts are 
known to each other, they do not necessarily have to break…even though he 
has been as far as he can go……..it implies that we all try to protect 
ourselves and our hearts and that we all try to chase unnecessary things in 
a relationship……the song implies there is something more that is 
lacking….and asks the questions are we really so helpless in our human 
natures…. the answers seems to be no…..it is a choice to make though the 
song seems to speak from a place where the relationship has already 
broken……..but there is hope of reconciliation if they both realise what 
they have done and were doing………… it is sad song with hope where as always 
LOVE and a faith in something higher is the answer not just nature itself 
but we need to change for things and relationships to work…we need to stop 
chasing the changing and ephemeral and transient things in life and keep to 
what is permanent and true and higher and wiser….it implies we need God not 
just to go our own way ourselves. The lyrics contain words like being out 
drowning is no sin and of knowing shipwrecked souls ……. it is a religious 
song of love. We need God and faith and to change our ways and what we 
desire and chase in life.

NOTE I am not pressing or pushing religion here at all I am just saying 
what it means........﻿

Apple taking the publics pulse? A subtle totalitarianism emerges... 
Totalitarianism: A concept where the state holds total authority over 
society and seeks to control all aspects of public and private life 
wherever possible. Suckered into overworking to further consumerism... 
exhausted, distracted and asleep... control over the public is simple… 
“Bread and circus" continues, how much, how soon? How subtle or obvious, 
these tests will continue to take our pulse, and "push" further each time, 
until too exhausted, more is surrendered up, all served up with an illusion 
of choice. And each passing generation understands it to be the norm and 
doesn't question the state. Easy prey we.﻿
